summary: Create a payment provider app named Shanju that lets users make and manage payments.
architectural_notes: Plan for external platform integrations (Shopify, WordPress/WooCommerce, others) via a connector layer with per-platform auth and data sync.
Plan for multi-currency support (currency codes, formatting, exchange-rate handling/settlement) and global payment rails/region compliance considerations.
Plan a hosted checkout/payment-link flow with per-link status (active/inactive) and configurable payment methods (card, PayPal).
Plan bot-protection (CAPTCHA) integration for hosted checkout/payment-link pages (including rate limiting/abuse monitoring).

existing_features.title: Create the Shanju app shell with routing and core pages for a payment provider workflow: Sign in, Dashboard, Create Payment, Payment Details, and Payment History.
Add Internet Identity sign-in and use the authenticated principal as the user identity for all payment data operations.

Build the frontend payment management UI that connects to the backend: create a payment request form, list and filter payments by status, and a payment details view with actions to mark as Paid or Cancelled.
Add a coherent, distinct visual theme for Shanju (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across all pages (avoid blue & purple as primary brand colors).
Add a generated static brand logo asset for Shanju and render it in the app header and the sign-in screen.
Add a frontend "Integrations" area where signed-in users can manage connectors: create a connector, see a list of connectors, and toggle a connector between Active and Inactive.
Add React Query hooks and frontend-to-backend integration for connector CRUD operations, following the existing patterns used for payments and user profiles.
Update the frontend Create Payment form to allow selecting/entering a currency (ISO 4217 code) and submit it to the backend instead of hard-coding USD.
Update payment list and payment details UI to display amounts using the stored currency (code or localized currency formatting) instead of always using '$' and USD.
Update the frontend payment React Query hooks and generated backend typings usage to match the updated backend payment APIs (including currency in create/get/list flows).

Add an in-app explanation (English) clarifying that Shanju supports creating payment requests in multiple currencies worldwide, while not performing real payment rail settlement or live FX conversion inside the app.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build the Shanju payment provider app for making and managing payments

Implement backend data models and persistence for payments so users can make and manage payments: create a payment request, list payment requests, view a single payment request, and update payment status (e.g., Pending, Paid, Cancelled).
Add an integration/connector system to connect Shanju with external ecommerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, WordPress/WooCommerce, and other platforms) and enable it for active use.

Add backend support for an ecommerce platform connector system that lets an authenticated user create, view, list, update, and delete their platform connections for Shopify, WordPress/WooCommerce, and a generic "Other" platform type.
Support instant worldwide payments with multi-currency acceptance for all user locations.
Extend the backend payment data model and APIs to support multi-currency payment requests by storing an ISO 4217 currency code on each Payment and accepting the currency code when creating a payment.
Add "Buy Now" payment links that users can generate/manage, with an active/inactive toggle for each link.
Add bot protection (e.g., CAPTCHA) to payment link checkout flows.
Add payment method options on payment links/checkout (enable/disable credit/debit card and PayPal).
